result.execSummary:
The defendant Melodie Valentina Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: the sentence in Count 2.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, assessments, and surcharges (including DNA and domestic violence surcharges); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
Provide a DNA sample.
No contact with the minor children except as authorized by Children's Court or a social worker.

Participate in any assessment that is deemed appropriate by the agent.
Participate in anger management if it is deemed appropriate by the agent.
Complete a parenting class.
Comply with and Children's Court or Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare order.
Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: the sentence in Count 1.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melodie Valentina Schultz in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Melodie Valentina Schultz in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 1 day credit CONSECUTIVE to the sentence in Count 2.

As to Count 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections CONSECUTIVE to the sentence in Count 1.

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on 16 MONTHS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
-Participate in any assessment that is deemed appropriate by the agent.
-Participate in anger management if it is deemed appropriate by the agent.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Comply with and Chilren's Court or Buearu of Milwaukee Child Welfare order.
-Absolute sobirety.
-No contact with the minor children except as authorized by Children's Court or a social worker.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, assessments, and surcharges (including DNA and domestic violence surcharges); 
All applicable fees of supervision.


Filed:  
Memorandum of Condition of Probation 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Melodie Valentina Schultz in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions/Elements, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the State, court ordered case Dismissed, but Read In.

Case adjourned for Sentencing. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 36.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Melodie Valentina Schultz in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea Hearing. Defense counsel requested an adjournment of the plea hearing.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Melodie Valentina Schultz in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for a Plea Hearing. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Melodie Valentina Schultz in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for Abbey Desiato for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.  Defense counsel advised the court that the defendant was sitting in the hallway at the end of the hall. Defendant is now present.  Court withdraws the stayed bench warrant.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 23 on 4-16-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for Molly Schmidt for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was present earlier this morning, per defense counsel.  Discovery was provided to defense counsel.  Due to the assignment of ADA Molly Schmidt, case transferred FORTHWITH to branch 23.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 4:00 pm (today's date).   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CE and her children MAE; AND AJE, unless as approved per Children's Court Orders,or if Children's Court is not involved, unless as approved and monitored by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.

Defendant Melodie Valentina Schultz in court.  James J Martin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 4. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 4  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/19/15 @ 1:30pm

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-11-2015
